page.title: 10 'PARSON'S FOLLY'
page.content: Within the village of Tonna we have many places of interest,one of which,a local landmark,is the{Ivy Tower.}This tower used to be a Summer guest house for the people visiting the old{Gnoll {House.}They used to hold Summer dances there.Very near this place is the area known as{'Parson's Folly'. This area used to have a bridge with railway lines crossing over it. Long ago it carried trucks of coal from one of the local collieries.One local story tells us of a{Mr.Parsons, who was the architect who designed the bridge.Apparently after being in use for a while,something went wrong and the bridge collapsed.Mr.Parsons worried so much over this that he committed suicide - and hence the name {'PARSON'S FOLLY'.
